info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 25 at 7:52PM PDT until August 26 at 7:45AM PDT by NWS Phoenix AZ
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of southeast California, including the following county, Imperial.
* WHEN...Until 745 AM PDT Tuesday.
* IMPACTS...Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. Local law enforcement have reported water rescues.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 750 PM PDT, local law enforcement reported flooded roadways and water rescues near Highway 86 and Highway 78. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Tule Wash, San Felipe Creek and Tarantula Wash. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Salton City and Winona. - This includes CA Route 86 between mile markers 44 and 53. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 AM PDT TUESDAY... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING
